definition: to record/to note/to memorize/to remember/mark/sign/classifier for blows, kicks, shots
France/French/abbr. for 法國|法国[Fa3 guo2]/Taiwan pr. [Fa4]
law/method/way/to emulate/(Buddhism) dharma/(abbr. for 法家[Fa3 jia1]) the Legalists/(physics) farad (abbr. for 法拉[fa3 la1])

sentences.english: That you look at , this writes down law is much more amusing than cramming up.
sentences.chinese: 你看，这个记法比死记硬背要有趣得多。

sentences.english: This new operator is, in fact, a shortcut notation for the ternary operator.
sentences.chinese: 这个新操作符实际上是一个三目操作符的便捷记法。

sentences.english: He took down a speech in shorthand .
sentences.chinese: 他用速记法把演说记下来。

sentences.english: Sophie quickly found some paper and copied it down longhand .
sentences.chinese: 索菲很快找了一张纸条，用速记法把它抄了下来。

sentences.english: The parameters were recorded by MedLab Biological Signal Collection System.
sentences.chinese: 采用生物信号采集处理系统分析描记法进行研究。

sentences.english: Any notation for the representation of numbers.
sentences.chinese: 用于数表示的任何一种记法。

sentences.english: Those problems will be solved in Business Registration Law.
sentences.chinese: 期望在《商事登记法》中进行改进。

definition: method of counting (e.g. decimal or Roman numbers)
names of the notes of a musical scale (e.g. C, D, E or do, re, mi)
rules of calculation (addition, subtraction, multiplication and division)/algorithm/fig. to scheme/to calculate (i.e. plot)
(music) accidental (symbol such as a sharp (♯), flat (♭), natural (♮) etc)
reading or phonetic value of a character
